NO MORE BOMBS

NO MORE WAR

NO MORE GENOCIDE

events.title: One Million Rising: One Million Trained, Millions More Empowered
events.description:
https://www.mobilize.us/nokings/event/803953/

Across the country, authoritarian forces are getting bolder and more dangerous. Trump and his allies are not hiding their agenda: mass deportations, rollbacks of civil rights, weaponized courts, and full-scale attacks on our democracy. We don’t have to wait until it’s too late. We can stop this. But it’ll take all of us. That’s why this summer, we’re launching

One Million Rising — a national effort to train one million people to help lead in this moment and gain the skills to lead others. This is how we build people power that can’t be ignored. You’re invited to join us—and lead.

Let’s build a force bigger than fear and louder than hate. Let’s get ready. Let’s get organized. Let’s stop Trump.

events.title: Hands off Medicaid Rally
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Join us for a powerful community demonstration to defend Medicaid and stand up to Representative Ciscomani's proposed cuts!

Address Note: Parking is difficult. It is recommended to park across Grant Street near the CVS.

organizer.name: Jobs With Justice | Working Families Power | Social Security Works

events.title: Budget Bill Town Hall
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Trump's "Big Beautiful Bill" will give enormous tax breaks to billionaires while slashing Medicaid, Veterans' resources, food assistance and education. Juan Ciscomani voted for this bill and he is invited to this event to listen to your questions. Since he is unlikely to attend, you will be able to hear from a panel of experts about the impacts of enacting this bill and how we can take action against it. Event now 1pm-3pm. Capacity of 271 seats.

events.title: Jump into Activism!
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Join Dudes for Democracy for an afternoon that mixes high-energy fun with serious community building.

Whether you’re already civically engaged or looking to meet new friends to canvass or attend events with, this is the place to meet motivated peers in a laid-back setting. Come for the trampolines; leave with connections and next steps to save our democracy.

events.title: Stop the War on Iran!
events.description:
Trump’s unprovoked bombing of Iranian nuclear facilities is an outright war crime. It violates the UN Charter, international law and the U.S. Constitution. It threatens to set into motion a regional or even global war with massive casualties, nuclear radiation, and catastrophic consequences.

Read More

events.title: Save Democracy Meetup
events.description:
Join Take Action Tucson for a gathering as we work to preserve our rights and save our democracy!

Our meetup will start with the latest updates on Take Action Tucson's outreach efforts, presentations by members, then an opportunity to connect with one another and build this pro-democracy community.

events.title: Disappeared In America Visual Action
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

In America, the government doesn’t get to grab people off the streets, skip the courtroom, and send them straight to a foreign prison.

Disappeared in America is a national day of action to stand up for the rule of law and confront the Trump administration’s illegal abductions, detentions, and deportations of people like Kilmar Abrego Garcia, Rui Marras, and Juan Maldonado Zuniga.

On June 26th we are launching a national photo petition day where people will take photos with posters of those who have been disappeared and flood social media with the truth.

events.title: Deep Canvass Training
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Join Save Our Schools Arizona to learn about our deep canvassing efforts and how to have meaningful conversations with swing voters. Deep canvassing focuses on listening and connecting with voters to understand their concerns, questions, and perspectives on public education.

events.title: Civics Series: Local Government
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Learn all about how city and county government works including City Council, Boards & Commissions, and county Board of Supervisors, and your role in making change! This will be a virtual training with lots of time for questions.

events.title: Free America Weekend!
events.description:
SAVE THE DATE!

This July 4th, while the U.S. marks Independence Day, we’ll gather across the country—on porches, in town squares, backyards, and streets—to stand for real freedom and build a vision of a Free America brick by brick. Free America is wherever we are. Free America is whatever we make it.

events.title:
Stop the VA Cuts -
 Rally for Veterans 
and Workers
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

The Save Our VA (SOVA) Coalition is asking you to stand together to say NO to cuts in veterans' care and YES to solidarity with VA workers and VA healthcare. Join us outside the main entrance of the Tucson VA (6th Ave) on Monday, July 1st, from 7:00 to 8:15 a.m. as we rally to oppose the appointment of a new Southern VA Director poised to deepen the harmful cuts initiated under Representative Ciscomani and the Trump administration. SOVA includes Veterans for Peace, Common Defense, Southern AZ Community Activists, Working Families Power and Honest Arizona.

Please note that this Tuesday rally replaces this week's recurring Friday VA event.

events.title: Fund Care Not Billionaires
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Join us on July 1st to protect our right to health and oppose attacks on essential public health services that keep our communities healthy and safe. On this Day of Action, we will come together to demand that Congress and the administration fund care, not billionaires, by pledging to defend Medicaid and Medicare, Social Security, the VA and federal health workers, and public health protections.

No prior experience necessary to join; all are welcome. Thanks for joining us in the fight for health care justice.

events.title: Stop the Billionaire Giveaway Bus Tour
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

From June 21 to July 14, the Stop the Billionaire Giveaway Bus Tour, brought to you by Fair Share America and Unrig Our Economy, is traveling coast to coast to expose how the ultra-wealthy and giant corporations have rigged the tax code—at the expense of working families—and how their new budget bill would make things even worse.

Our message is clear: The big budget bill moving through Congress makes our broken system even worse by ripping away health care and food away from millions while raising prices – all to give billionaires another massive tax break. We’re showing up in towns and cities across the country to shine a light on how tax loopholes, corporate handouts, and political power plays are draining resources from health care, education, food assistance, and other essentials that families need.

organizer.name: Fair Share America, Unrig Our Economy

events.title: Death of Due Process: The Black Parade
events.description:
Due process is gone—Join us in this public funeral procession that will honor those who should never have died in ICE custody and to mourn The Death of Due Process. 

We will gather in grief and resolve—with a banner drop, eulogy, and funeral procession.

Flowers and candles will be provided in remembrance, and we invite others to dress in black funeral attire, be creative and bring your own candles if you’d like—let’s make our presence impossible to ignore! Let us turn sorrow into a demand for dignity and accountability! 

5:30PM: Meet at 400 W Congress 
6:00PM: March to Garcés Footbridge

Banner drop and eulogy at the footbridge followed by an optional funeral procession through Congress St to 4th Ave. 

Please also make time in your evening to attend the vigil for Saif Musalat at El Tiradito Shrine at 7:30pm.

events.title: Data Center Information & Postcard Writing Session
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Join Watershed Management Group and members of the No Desert Data Centers coalition for an advocacy and informational session about the water impacts of the Project Blue data centers proposed for southeast Tucson.

We will hear from speakers sharing more information on the water impacts of data centers, learn more about water resiliency in Southern Arizona, and write postcards to send to City Council members and the Mayor’s office to oppose this project.

events.title: Illuminate Injustice: Trump and Epstein
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP Lamplighters present Illuminate Injustice: Trump and Epstein, as part of 50501 Rage Against the Regime. This is a peaceful protest uniting the community to shine light on Trump's personal relationship with Jeffrey Epstein and his administration's mishandling of the Epstein case, denying justice for their victims.

Meet at the corner of 22nd and Country Club with signs focused on Trump and Epstein, as well as water, hats, and sunscreen! Peacekeepers and medics will be present, but also please be mindful of your personal safety and the needs of others.

August 2nd marks a pivotal National Day of Action, uniting communities across the nation in a shared purpose: Rage Against the Regime. On this day, we come together to transform anger into action, harnessing the energy of collective resistance. Our movement is rooted in non-violence, but it is far from passive. We stand strong, bold, and unyielding, showing the world the irresistible force of communities united against injustice.

location.name: E 22nd Street & S Country Club Road
location.address: East 22nd Street & South Country Club Road, E 22nd St & S Country Club Rd, Tucson, AZ 85716, USA

events.title: Accountability Summer Town Hall
events.description:
https://www.mobilize.us/yassaminforcongress/event/816306/

This summer, join Congresswoman Yassamin Ansari on the Accountability Summer Town Hall Tour—a powerful series of community events exposing the real-life consequences of the Trump-backed Reconciliation Bill.

From rural hospital shutdowns to devastating cuts in Medicaid, food assistance, and job programs, Arizonans deserve to know the truth—and who’s responsible (hint: their Congressmen). These town halls will pull back the curtain, connect the dots, and give voters a platform to demand better from their elected leaders.

If you would like to speak or get involved with the town hall, please email maria@yassaminforcongress.com with your [FULL NAME - Town Hall] in the subject line and your question, phone number, and zip code in the body of the email.

RSVP is required to attend.

events.title: No Data Centers Rally
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

This rally at City Hall on Aug 5th at 8am - is a call from one Tucsonan to all others who are stunned by the possibility of water- and electricity-guzzling data centers coming to our valley. Express your opposition to Project Blue by gathering in the tree shaded area directly North of the main entrance to Tucson City Hall (along Alameda Street) on Tuesday, August 5th at 8 AM.

Your views are welcome; a bullhorn will be provided. Bring signs for display toward the building and along the street. Please bring whatever you need for the weather: drinking water, hats, snacks, etc. – and who knows, maybe umbrellas!

Three Facts about "Project Blue" The operator of the proposed Data Center has remained secret - Local Lawmakers signed an NDA, with a promise not to reveal the owner/operator to their constituents. Project Blue would require about 6 percent of Tucson's total reclaimed water capacity. The Data Center will use ground water for the first two years. "Project Blue" AI Data Center will become TEP's largest customer.

Park in nearby public garages. Bring your passion; leave weapons at home.

RSVP is required to attend! Doors Open: 2:30 PM Location will be announced a day before the event

events.title: People Power Series: Organizing to Protect Democracy Session 2
events.description:
Click here for more information and to register

Ready to turn your passion into action? Join the second session in ACLU People Power's New Series: Organizing to Protect Democracy, happening on August 7th at 8 PM ET!

We are in the fight of a lifetime to defend our rights, our freedoms, and our democracy. This is the second session in our free, high impact, virtual training series built to ignite your activism and give you the tools to organize, mobilize, and lead in this critical moment. Our communities need bold action, and we need you in the fight.

You'll learn how to: Organize effectively in your community Have persuasive conversations that move people to action Build lasting connections with others who are ready to rise to the moment

This is the second in a 4-part training series that is designed for people ready to turn passion into action - and to take on an even greater leadership role in their community. Space is limited, so sign up now to reserve your spot. All we ask is that you commit to attend and share info about this training with friends and family. Organizing is relational, and the path forward depends on all of us.

Now is the moment to stand up for our democracy, so join us for this training and be part of the movement for change.

events.title: Welcome Home, Ciscomani - Save Our VA Rally
events.description:
Click here for more info and to RSVP!

Representative Juan Ciscomani has been unresponsive to his constituents and especially to the veterans who depend on quality care at the Tucson VA. As critical jobs and services at the VA hang in the balance, his silence is unacceptable.

Despite repeated phone calls, rallies, and town halls, Rep. Ciscomani continues to ignore our concerns and instead aligns himself with Trump’s harmful agenda to dismantle the working class. His refusal to speak out or stand up for veterans is a betrayal to those who served.

Join us on August 8th at the Tucson VA to make our voices heard. We will gather to demand transparency, answers, and accountability. This August recess is the time for Representative Ciscomani to face the people he was elected to represent.

events.title: Nonviolent Direct Action Training
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

"Nonviolence is the science of how you create a world that practices justice, truth, and compassion." - Reverend James M. Lawson

This interactive session equips participants with the principles and practical tools of non-violent direct action. Rooted in a rich history of social change, the training will cover strategy, group dynamics, creative protest methods, and how to stay grounded and safe during action.

Whether you're new to activism and organizing or looking to sharpen your skills during this era of resistance, this training offers a collaborative space to build courage, clarity, and community.

“La no violencia es la ciencia que nos permite crear un mundo que practique la justicia, la verdad y la compasión.” - Reverendo James M. Lawson

Esta sesión interactiva proporciona a los participantes los principios y las herramientas prácticas de la acción directa y no-violenta. Con una rica historia de cambio social, la capacitación abordará estrategias, dinámicas de grupo, métodos creativos de protesta y cómo mantener la estabilidad y la seguridad durante una acción. Tanto si eres nuevo en el activismo y la organización como si buscas perfeccionar tus habilidades en esta era de resistencia, este entrenamiento ofrece un espacio colaborativo para desarrollar valentía, claridad y comunidad.

events.title: Save the Date: Event TBA
events.description: Check back for updates on a nonviolent direct action by the organizer of the Stop Funding Ciscomani Jim Click Kia action.

events.title: One Million Rising
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Across the country, authoritarian forces are getting bolder and more dangerous. Trump and his allies are not hiding their agenda: mass deportations, rollbacks of civil rights, weaponized courts, and full-scale attacks on our democracy. We don’t have to wait until it’s too late. We can stop this. But it’ll take all of us. That’s why this summer, we’re launching One Million Rising — a national effort to train one million people to help lead in this moment and gain the skills to lead others. This is how we build people power that can’t be ignored. You’re invited to join us—and lead.

Let’s build a force bigger than fear and louder than hate. Let’s get ready. Let’s get organized. Let’s stop Trump.

He voted to cut the Social Security benefits we earned. We’re showing up to say: not on our watch!

Please be sure to bring your own chair if needed.

events.title: Fight the Trump Takeover
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

The Texas House Democrats are denying quorum to stop the Trump takeover of Texas and block his attempt to rig the 2026 midterm elections. But Trump isn’t stopping in Texas. He’s targeting Missouri, Ohio, Florida, and every state he can twist to help him steal Congress next year. States like California and New York are starting to fight back.

Let's show them that Tucson is fighting back too! Bring your signs to the corner of 22nd and Country Club at Reid Park for a peaceful demonstration from 5pm to 7pm.

events.title: Picket Jim Click
events.description:
Click here for more information and to RSVP

Jim Click is one of the top donors to Rep. Juan Ciscomani — Congressman in Arizona’s 6th District who voted for the largest health care cuts in US history, failed to support reproductive freedom and refused to face his constituents. Rep. Ciscomani’s actions are dangerous, and we’re making sure that the money backing him knows we’re watching and won’t stand for it.

This picket will uplift our voices in defense of reproductive freedom and the right to make our own healthcare decisions. Together with our union allies, we’ll send a message loud and clear: Arizonans won’t stand by while billionaires bankroll anti-freedom politicians.

Bring your signs, your friends, and your voice!
